lead_paragraph: A project to modernize medical record-keeping for California inmates has more than doubled in cost from original estimates, to nearly $400 million in three years.

headline.print_headline: Prison Health Records Project Balloons in Cost in California
headline.main: Medical Records Overhaul for California Prisons Is Delayed and Over Budget

snippet: A project to modernize medical record-keeping for California inmates has more than doubled in cost from original estimates, to nearly $400 million in three years....
abstract: California officials report cost of project to modernize and streamline state's medical records system for prison inmates has reached almost $400 million, more than double original 2013 price tag; transition to electronic system has also been plagued by other problems, threatening timetable for implementation and alarming inmate advocates.
